text: This is the bane of every content team’s existence! I’ve found the best way to avoid being a service provider / internal agency for every other team is to set very clear team goal, KPIs, and roadmap for your the team and every content marketer in your team. For example, if your team goal is SEO/traffic then anything that’s not contributing to that (e.g. emails/ads) would be a low priority (only if you have time), etc. Or if your team goal is organic growth then you shouldn’t be focusing on creating ad copy. Same for your roadmap, if people see you have all these important projects going on then it’s much easier to say no. Your own KPIs and roadmap are your best defense. and continuous education/reminder internally so people know the content team has its own goals and priorities and not just there to produce content (like the design team)
